On 7/31/10 4:59 AM, compa.marco wrote:
>
> Hi, i have inserted the SurtPrefix in the Scope Module using +http://(it, because i want to retrieve only it domain pages.
> I use the ChangeEvaluator and HTTP, HTML, PDF, DOC, JSP, ExtractorUri extractor and in the submodule i have configured HTTP, HTML and ExtractorUri with the rule about SurtPrefix.
> My problem is this:
> there are some image in the log file of my crawl that are store in .com pages, some exaple here:
>
> 2010-07-31T09:30:44.458Z   200       3666 http://i2.ytimg.com/vi/NY34VKzBgB0/default.jpg LLLLX http://www.beppegrillo.it/ image/jpeg #004 20100731093044330+128 sha1:AMINTX3V6PKRKU4CWGWSUOSECDPGBFY6 - -
>
> so my problem is the working production of SurtPrefixedDecideRule using a seed list from dmoz.org (even if it is out of scope itself) on the image processed by the crawler.

I'm not sure that I understand your question, but it might be this 
common issue:

https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/unexpected+offsite+content

> My second problem is, how does heritrix fetch dynamic pages??
> For example will these two pages
> http://events.ictp.it/today/Activity_Single?id=a09160
> http://events.ictp.it/today/Activity_Single?id=a09185
> fetched indipendently one from the other if they are linked from the same page (so the crawler can reach them)?

Those are two separate URIs as far as Heritrix is concerned. (The 
?query-strings are significant unless you've customized the 
configuration to collapse them, as happens for a few well-known 
query-string session-ids in the URI canonicalization code.)

- Gordon @ IA
